ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's important to take QFT if you are in experimental particle physics...

QFT I is a great introduction to the theory of modern particle physics. It's one of those classes that everybody in the Physics PhD program should have to take to call him/herself a physicist. It was a great class I would recommend to anybody!
Yes, definitely would recommend the course.
Interesting material, great lectures, definitely recommend it.
If the student in very interesting in theoretical physics or particle physics, this course is a must; otherwise, it is painful.
I would definitely recommend this course to a fellow student. It is an important course for the majority of physicists and the class is well taught at Yale.
I would recommend this course. Despite some pacing issues at the end, I learned a tremendous amount.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It provided me with my first exposure to QFT, and it made me excited to take further courses in particle theory.
I've already been able to understand a lot more of some phenomenology courses.
I had taken an introductory class on QFT before, but this helped to make many concepts much clearer. My research is very tied to the topics discussed in the course.
It deepened my knowledge, not sure how it contributes to my dissertation/research other than giving me a better idea about physics.
Although this course is not required for my field (Astro/cosmology), I feel like this course greatly expanded my physics knowledge. I took the class for general interest and I am glad I did.
